kannada:
ಊರೆಲ್ಲ ನೆಂಟರು | ಕೇರಿಯೆಲ್ಲವು ಬಳಗೆ |
ಧಾರಿಣಿಯಲ್ಲ ಕುಲದೈವನಾಗಿನ್ನು |
ಯಾರನ್ನು ಬಿಡಲೊ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Oorella nentaru | keriyellavu balage |
dhaariniyalla kuladaivanaaginnu |
yaarannu bidalo Sarvajna ||
translation: The whole village is my kin, and the entire street is my family; when the whole earth is the manifestation of the divine, whom can I possibly exclude, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ನಂದಿಯನು ಏರಿದನ | ಚಂದಿರನ ಸೂಡಿದನ |
ಕಂದನ ಬೇಡಿ ನಲಿದಾನು ನೆನೆವುತ್ತ |
ಮುಂದೆ ಹೇಳುವೆನು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Nandiyanu eeridana | chandirana soodidana |
kandana beedi nalidaanu nenevutta |
munde heluvenu Sarvajna ||
translation: Meditating upon the one who rides the bull Nandi and wears the moon as an adornment—the one who rejoiced when asked for a child—I shall proceed with my recitations, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಅಂದು ಜೇಡರ ದಾಸ | ಹಿಂದೆ ನಾ ವರರುಚಿಯು |
ಇಂದು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ನಾ ನಿಮ್ಮ ಕರುಣದ |
ಕಂದ ಕಾಣಯ್ಯ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Andu Jedara Daasa | hinde naa Vararuchiyu |
indu Sarvajna naa nimma karunada |
kanda kaanayya Sarvajna ||
translation: Once I was Jedara Dasimayya, before that I was Vararuchi; today, by your grace, I am Sarvajna, your own child, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮುನ್ನ ಕೈಲಾಸದಲಿ ಪನ್ನಗಧರನಾಳು |
ಎನ್ನಯ ಪೆಸರು ಪುಷ್ಪದತ್ತನು ಎಂದು |
ಮನ್ನಿಪರು ದಯದಿ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Munna Kailasadali pannagadharanaalu |
ennaya pesaru Pushpadattanu endu |
manniparu dayadi Sarvajna ||
translation: Formerly in Kailasa, as an attendant to the one who wears the serpent (Shiva), my name was Pushpadatta; thus they recognize me with grace, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಅಂದಿನ ಪುಷ್ಪದತ್ತ ಬಂದ ವರರುಚಿಯಾಗಿ |
ಮುಂದವ ಸಾಲೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞನೆಂದೆನಿಸಿ |
ನಿಂದವನು ನಾನೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Andina Pushpadatta banda Vararuchiyaagi |
mundava saale Sarvajnanendenisi |
nindavanu naane Sarvajna ||
translation: The Pushpadatta of those days came as Vararuchi, and subsequently, having become known to the world as Sarvajna, that same person am I, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮಕ್ಕಳಿಲ್ಲವೆಂದು ಅಕ್ಕಮಲ್ಲಮ್ಮನು |
ದುಕ್ಕವ ಬಸವರಸಗರುಪಲು ಕಾಸಿಯ |
ಮುಕ್ಕಣ್ಣನೊಲಿದ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Makkalillavendu Akkamallammanu |
dukkava Basavarasagarupalu Kaasiya |
Mukkannanolida Sarvajna ||
translation: When Akkamallamma expressed her grief of being childless to Basavarasa, the three-eyed Lord of Kashi was pleased and granted a boon, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮಾಸೂರ ಬಸವರಸ ಕೂಸನೀಶನ ಕೇಳೆ |
ಕಾಶಿಯಾ ಅಭವನೊಳು ಪಡೆದ ವರವದು |
ಸೂಸಿತೆಂತೆನಲು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Maasura Basavarasa koosaneeshana kele |
Kaashiyaa abhavanolu padeda varavadu |
soositentenalu Sarvajna ||
translation: When Basavarasa of Masuru prayed to the Lord for a child, the boon obtained from the Lord of Kashi manifested; I shall tell how it flowed forth, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಗಂಡಾಗಬೇಕೆಂದು ಪಿಂಡವನು ನುಂಗಲದು |
ರಂಡೆಮಾಳವ್ವೆಯೊಳು ಬರುವೆನೆಂದೆನಲು |
ಕಂಡದನು ಪೇಳ್ದೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Gandagabekendu pindavanu nungaladu |
randemaalavveyolu baruvenendenalu |
kandadanu pelde Sarvajna ||
translation: Desiring a son, he swallowed the consecrated offering; as for how I came to be born through the widow Malavve, I have spoken of what was witnessed, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಗಡಿಗೆ ಮಡಿಕೆಯಕೊಂಡು ಅಡಿಗೆಯಾವೇಳೆಯೊಳು |
ಬಿಡದೆ ಮಳೆಮೋಡ ಪೊಡೆಯಲು ಈರ್ವರಿಗೆ |
ತಡೆಬಿಡಲಾಯ್ತು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Gadige madikeyakondu adigeyaveleyolu |
bidade malemooda podeyalu eervarige |
tadebidalaytu Sarvajna ||
translation: While busy with pots and pans at the time of cooking, as the rain clouds burst incessantly, the two were caught in a moment of sudden confusion, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಅಂಬಲೂರೋಳೆಸೆವ ಕುಂಬಾರಸಾಲೆಯಲಿ |
ಇಂಬಿನಾಕಳೆಮಾಳಿಯೊಳು ಬಸವರಸ- |
ನಿಂಬಿಟ್ಟನೆನ್ನ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Ambalooroleseva kumbaarasaaleyali |
imbinakalemaaliyolu basavarasa- |
nimbittanenna Sarvajna ||
translation: In the potter's street of Ambalur, within the graceful Mali, Basavarasa placed his seed; thus was I conceived, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಬಿಂದುವನು ಬಿಟ್ಟುಹೋದಂದು ಬಸಿರಾದಳವ- |
ಳೊಂದಾಗಿ ಹೊತ್ತ ದಶಮಾಸವುದರದಿ |
ನಿಂದಾನು ಬೆಳದೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Binduvanu bittuhoodandu basiraadalava- |
londaagi hotta dashamaasavudaradi |
nindaanu belade Sarvajna ||
translation: From the day the seed was left, she became pregnant; for ten months she carried me in her womb, and there I grew, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಹೆತ್ತವಳು ಮಾಳಿಯೆ | ನ್ನೂತ್ತಿ ತೆಗೆದವಳು ಬೆ- |
ನ್ನೊತ್ತಿ ಹಿಡಿದವಳು ಕಾಳಿಯು, ಮೊರದೊಳಗೆ |
ಬಿತ್ತರಿಸಿದವಳು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Hettavalu Maaliye | nnotti tegedavalu be- |
nnotti hididavalu Kaaliyu, moradolage |
bittarisidavalu Sarvajna ||
translation: Mali was the mother who gave birth; Kali was the one who lifted me up and supported my back, and laid me out in the winnowing basket, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಬೆಳೆಯೆನ್ನದರಿದೆಂದು ಕಳೆಯಕಂಡವರೆಲ್ಲ |
ಮೊಳೆಯನಲ್ಲಿ ಸಸಿಯನರಿತು ತಾಂ ಮಾಳಿಯ |
ತಿಳಿವವರು ಅರಿಗು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Beleyennadaridendu kaleyakandavarella |
moleyanalli sasiyanaritu taan maaliya |
tilivavaru arigu Sarvajna ||
translation: While everyone sees the crop, none saw the spark of its beginning; only those who understand how a seedling sprouts can truly know the mother Mali, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಗಂಡು ತನ್ನದು ಎಂದು | ಲಂಡೆ ಸುತನೆಂಬುವಳು |
ಖಂಡಪರಶುವಿನ ವರಪುತ್ರ ನಾನರೆ |
ಕಂಡುದನೆ ನುಡಿದೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Gandu tannadu endu | lande sutanembuvalu |
khandaparashuvina varaputra naanare |
kandudane nudide Sarvajna ||
translation: The woman claims this boy as her own son, but I am the boon-born son of Lord Shiva; I speak only the truth of what I have realized, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮಾಳನೂ ಮಾಳಿಯೂ ಕೂಳಿಂದ ಹೆಮ್ಮೆಯಲಿ |
ಕೇಳಲೆನ್ನಾರಮಗನೆಂದು, ನಾ ಶಿವನ |
ಮೇಳದವನೆಂದೆ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Maalanoo Maaliyu koolinda hemmeyali |
kelalennaramaganendu, naa shivana |
meladavanende Sarvajna ||
translation: Mala and Mali may claim me as their son with great pride, but listen—I belong to the assembly of Shiva, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ತಾ, ಎಂದೆನಲ್ಲದೆ ತಾಯಿ ನಾನೆಂದೆನೆ? |
ತಾಯಿಯೆಂದಾನು ನುಡಿದೇನು ಪರಸ್ತ್ರೀಯ |
ತಾಯಿಯೆಂದೆಂಬೆ! ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Taa, endenallade taayi naanendene? |
taapiyendaanu nudideenu parastreeya |
taayiyendembe! Sarvajna ||
translation: I acknowledged her, but did I call her 'my mother'? I address all other women as 'mother'; in that same sense, I spoke of her, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ನೂಕಿದರು ಅವರಾಗ ಕುಹಕತನದೊಳು ಬೇಗ |
ಲೋಕದೊಳಗೆಲ್ಲ ಕಂಡುದನು ನುಡಿದು ತಾ |
ನೇಕವಾಗಿಹನು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Nookidaru avaraaga kuhakatanadolu bega |
lookadolagella kandudanu nudidu taa |
neekavaagihanu Sarvajna ||
translation: Though they pushed him away in their malice, he spoke of all he witnessed in the world and became one with the Ultimate, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮೀರಿಬೆಳೆಯಲಿ ತನುವು ಆರುಬಣ್ಣವನುಡಿಸಿ |
ಮೂರುರುಚಿದೋರಿ ಮರಸಿ ತಾ ತನ್ನನು |
ತೋರದೇ ಹೋದ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Meeribeleyali tanuvu aarubannavanudisi |
mooru-ruchidoori marasi taa tannanu |
tooradee hooda Sarvajna ||
translation: As the body grows, draped in six colors and distracted by triple tastes, the soul forgets its true self and remains hidden, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಕುಲಗೆಟ್ಟಿವರು ಚಿಂತೆ ಯೊಳಗಿರ್ಪರಂತಲ್ಲ |
ಕುಲಗೆಟ್ಟು ಶಿವನ ಮರೆಹೊಕ್ಳ ಋಷಿಗಳು |
ಕುಲವಾದರಯ್ಯ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Kulagettivaru chinte yolagirpavantalla |
kulagettu shivana marehokla rishigalu |
kulavaadarayya Sarvajna ||
translation: Do not worry about those who have lost their caste; the sages who abandoned worldly status to seek refuge in Shiva became the highest lineage themselves, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಹೊಲಸುಮಾಂಸದಹುತ್ತ ಎಲುವಿನಾ ಹಂದರವು |
ಹೊಲೆಬಲಿದ ತನುವಿನೊಳಗಿರ್ದುಮದರೊಳು |
ಕುಲವನರಸುವರೆ? ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Holasumaamsadahutta eluvinaa handaravu |
holebalida tanuvinolagirdumadarolu |
kulavanarasuvare? Sarvajna ||
translation: In this mound of foul flesh and frame of bones, within a body bound by impurities—does one still go searching for caste? O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಎಲುವಿನೀಕಾಯಕ್ಕೆ ಸಲೆಚರ್ಮದಾಹೊದಿಕೆ |
ಮಲಮೂತ್ರ ಕ್ರಿಮಿಗಳೊಳಗಿರ್ದ ದೇಹಕೆ |
ಕುಲವಾವುದಯ್ಯ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Eluvineekaayakke salecharmadaahodike |
malamootra krimigalolagirda dehaake |
kulavaavudayya Sarvajna ||
translation: For this body made of bone and covered in a wrap of skin—a vessel for waste and germs—how can there be any talk of caste? O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಮಾಸಿನೊಳು ಮುಸುಕಿರ್ದು ಮೂಸಿಬಹುದಾಸನವ |
ಹೇಸಿಕೆ ಮಲವು ಸೂಸುವದಕಂಡು ಕುಲ- |
ದಾಸೆಯನುಬಿಡರು ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Maasinolu musukirdu moosibohudaasanava |
heesike malavu soosuvadakandu kula- |
daaseyanubidaru Sarvajna ||
translation: Though covered in filth and seeing the stench of waste that flows from this seat of a body, people still refuse to give up their attachment to caste, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞನೆಂಬವನು ಗರ್ವದಿಂದಾದವನೆ? |
ಸರ್ವರೊಳೊಂದೊಂದು ನುಡಿಗಲಿತು ವಿದ್ಯದ |
ಪರ್ವತವೆ ಆದ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Sarvajnanembavanu garvadindaadavane? |
sarvarolondondunudi galitu vidyada |
parvatave aada Sarvajna ||
translation: Did the one called 'All-Knowing' become so out of pride? By learning one word from everyone he met, Sarvajna became a mountain of knowledge, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಹೇಳಲರಿಯೆನು ನಾನು ಹೇಳೆನಲು ಹೇಳಿದೆನು |
ಬಾಳಲೋಚನನ ಶರಣರ ಆಳಾಗಿ |
ಹೇಳಿದೆನು ನೋಡ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Helalariyenu naanu helenalu helidenu |
baalaloochanana sharanara aalaagi |
helidenu nooda Sarvajna ||
translation: I do not claim to know how to speak; I spoke only because I was asked. As a servant to the devotees of the three-eyed Lord, I have shared these words, O Sarvajna.

kannada:
ಎನ್ನ ಮನಸಿಗೆ ನೆನಹ ಪನ್ನಗಧರ ಕೊಟ್ಟ |
ಬಿನ್ನಣದಿಂದ ಸ್ತುತಿಗೈದು ಪೊಗಳುವೆ |
ಚನ್ನ ಮೂರುತಿಯ ಸರ್ವಜ್ಞ ||
transliteration:
Enna manasige nenaha pannagadhara kotta |
binnanadinda stutigaiudu pogaluve |
channa moorutiya Sarvajna ||
translation: The Lord who wears the serpent gave the spark to my mind; with that skill, I praise and sing of the beautiful form of the Divine, O Sarvajna.
